name: Yellowstone National Park
description: Yellowstone National Park, established in 1872, is the first national park in the United States and widely considered the first in the world. The park is known for its geothermal features, wildlife, and diverse landscapes, including mountains, rivers, lakes, and forests.

locations.name: Old Faithful
locations.description: One of the most famous geysers in the world, erupting water up to 56 meters every 91 minutes.

locations.name: Grand Prismatic Spring
locations.description: The largest hot spring in the United States, known for vibrant colors caused by thermophilic bacteria.

locations.name: Yellowstone Lake
locations.description: Largest high-altitude lake in North America, situated at 2,357 meters above sea level.

locations.name: Norris Geyser Basin
locations.description: The hottest and most geothermally active area, home to Steamboat Geyser, the world's tallest active geyser.

locations.name: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
locations.description: A majestic 32 km canyon with Upper and Lower Falls, formed by volcanic activity.

locations.name: Mammoth Hot Springs
locations.description: Terraced hot springs known for their colorful travertine formations.

locations.name: Hayden Valley
locations.description: Famous for wildlife sightings, including bison, elk, and bears.

locations.name: Tower Fall
locations.description: A 41-meter waterfall near the Tower-Roosevelt area with unique rock formations.

trails.name: Upper Geyser Basin Loop
trails.description: Walking trail passing by numerous geysers including Old Faithful and Morning Glory Pool.

trails.name: Lone Star Geyser Trail
trails.description: Easy 6.4 km trail leading to Lone Star Geyser.

trails.name: Mount Washburn Trail
trails.description: Trail to the summit of Mount Washburn with panoramic views.

trails.name: Yellowstone Lake Trail
trails.description: Scenic trail along Yellowstone Lake with views of the water and mountains.

trails.name: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone Trail
trails.description: Trail along the canyon with multiple viewpoints of Upper and Lower Falls.

visitor_centers.name: Old Faithful Visitor Center
visitor_centers.description: Provides information, exhibits, and ranger programs about the park.

visitor_centers.name: Mammoth Hot Springs Visitor Center
visitor_centers.description: Historic center with exhibits on thermal features and wildlife.

visitor_centers.name: Canyon Visitor Education Center
visitor_centers.description: Educational exhibits and information on the Grand Canyon of Yellowstone.

campgrounds.name: Mammoth Campground
campgrounds.description: Located near Mammoth Hot Springs, open seasonally.

campgrounds.name: Canyon Campground
campgrounds.description: Near Grand Canyon, seasonal camping available.

campgrounds.name: Bridge Bay Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground near Yellowstone Lake with full facilities.

campgrounds.name: Grant Village Campground
campgrounds.description: Campground on the southern shore of Yellowstone Lake.

campgrounds.name: Fishing Bridge RV Park
campgrounds.description: RV-only campground near Yellowstone Lake, seasonal.

safety_tips: Carry water and snacks for hikes.
Dress in layers as weather can change quickly.
